title.narrative: 104/005 By 2020, existing sub-national coordinating structures have increased capacity to plan, monitor, implement and evaluate interventions that address children’s issues, particularly in urban, rural and Chittagong Hill Tracts districts, ensuring the mainstreaming of Disaster Risk Reduction. description.narrative: Sub-national coordinating structures such as the mechanism to enhance the planning, monitoring and implementation of development programmes addressing children's issues were the focus of the capacity enhancement efforts, including use of evidence for child-responsive planning and budgeting. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number and proportion of districts and City Corporations that have reflected children-related priorities in the annual local development plans

actual.value: 2019:22 UNICEF programme districts (3 Hill Districts in Chittagong Division and 19 other districts) 11 City Corporations

title.narrative: Number and proportion of districts and City Corporations that have functioning mechanisms/ platforms to review situation analysis and identify children-related issues and priorities

Number and proportion of districts and City Corporations that have Disaster Management Committees functioning and able to develop child-responsive risk-informed disaster risk reduction (DRR) action plans
City Corporations led service delivery models are assessed and findings are disseminated with city corporations and sectoral ministries by LGD & UNICEF for use in future programming
Number of BCO Strategy Notes (sectoral, ECD, Adolescence) which include specific strategies towards the reduction of inequity for children in urban areas
